examples: a jigget of beef  jiggets of mutton

verbs.description: jigget (third-person singular simple present jiggets, present participle jiggetting or jiggeting, simple past and past participle jiggetted or jiggeted)

entries.meaning: (dated) To gad; to move from one place to another in a (seemingly) flippant or idle manner.
examples: " […]  and jiggetting to outlandish countries, you'll do well to give her a hint to keep astern of me; for I shall never uphold a person who behaves o' that sort."
